choices.text: A person with visual acuity 6/6 can see this letter from a distance of 60 m
A person with visual acuity 6/60 can see this letter from a distance of 6 m
It will not be seen by an amblyopic person due to crowding phenomeon
The total angle subtended by this letter to a person eye from 6 m distance is 50 minutes of arc

questions.text: Which of the following is not true for top letter in Snellen chart?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

ETDRS chart letters are not seen by amblyopic person

questions.text: A 20 yr old girl with painful eye movements and sudden decrease in vision had this MRI findings. Which of the following devices should be used to assess the structure most likely having pathology in this scenario?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

a-	Direct ophthalmoscope
b-	Fundoscope
c-	Slit lamp
d-	Slit lamp plus lenses (for optic disc evaluation in optic neuritis in Multiple sclerosis)

questions.text: What is magnification of fundoscope when done for a hyperopic patient of 15 D, the doctor using 20D lens?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)


Magnification= power of eye of patient/power of lens used 
Power of eye of hyperopia 15 D is 45 D (assuming 60D is emmetropic)

questions.text: A 45 year old patient has jaundice, tremors, difficulty speaking, unsteady walking, and muscle stiffness. Which of the following is expected in his lens?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

a-    Sunflower cataract in Wilson (as description in question)
b-    Snowfalke cataract in Type 1 DM
c-    Christmas tree cataract in Myotonic dystrophy
d-    Rosette cataract in blunt trauma

choices.text: Inert and can be left in eye
Maintain Anterior chamber in Capsulorhexis and IOL implantataion
SF6, perflurane are commonly used viscoelastic substance

questions.text: Which of the following is true regarding Viscoelastics in cataract surgery?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Viscoelastics maintain anterior chamber of eye
If its left in eye, it can lead to high IOP
Methyl cellulose, hyaluronate are used as viscoelastics

questions.text: After cataract surgery, the doctor noted that there was shallow anterior chamber, increased IOP and bowing of the iris. The condition resolved on antiglaucoma drugs and laser iridotomy. What is the scenario among the following?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Pupil block leading to iris bombe is relieved by laser iridotomy

questions.text: On the fifth post-op day after complicated cataract surgery, the doctor noted following findings. The visual acuity was hand movements with severe pain. There were cells in anterior chamber with hypopyon. Cornea had infiltrates and scleral absecss noted. Ultrasound B scan revealed vitreous exudates. Which of the following could be the cause?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

All layers of eyeball involved in panophthalmitis

questions.text: Which complication of cataract surgery has Siedel test positive?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Wound leak is tested by Siedel.

questions.text: A 10 year old tall boy was brought by his parents for blurred vision since past 1 month. On eye examination, there was a crescent seen in pupil area. Which of the following causes can lead to such finding?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Crescent in pupil suggest subluxated lens
Homocystinuria - Deficiency of cystathionine beta synthase
Marfan- Abnormality in fibrillin
Sulfite oxidase deficiency
Galactokinase enzyme deficiency – galactosemia does not have subluxation of lens

choices.text: Increase in curvature of anterior lens

questions.text: A pseudophakic person is asked to focus on a near object. The following changes will be seen in his eyes?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Accommodation is lost in pseudophakic person, so a,b and c options are not possible
Pupil will constrict in near vision

choices.text: The pigment concentration is maximum in peripheral retina
The Bruch membrane separates the Retinal pigment epithelium from the choriocapillaris

questions.text: Which is not true for retina?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

The pigment concentration is maximum in central retina

choices.text: These are axons of ganglion cells

questions.text: Which is not true for the marked fibres?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Superior radiating nerve fibres
Most susceptible to glaucoma are arcuate fibres

questions.text: The given visual field can be seen in which of the following optic disc?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Enlargement of blind spot is seen
a-    Normal optic disc
b-    Myelinated nerve fibres
c-    increased cupping in glaucoma
d-    lamina dot sign in glaucoma

questions.text: The following findings were noted by the ophthalmologist. What could be the diagnosis? Gonioscopy – doctor was able to see scleral spur in 270 degrees of angle Intraocular pressure – 26 mm Hg Optic disc- inferior neuroretinal rim loss Visual field – as shown
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Visual field defect is seen in right visual field
Angle is open as more than 180 degree of trabecular meshwork is seen

questions.text: A patient presented with pain, watering, redness and photophobia from left eye since a day. There was circumcorneal congestion in that eye. On staining of cornea with fluorescein dye, branching pattern with knobs at its ends was noted. The corneal sensations were also decreased. The anterior chamber showed some cells with Intraocular pressure (IOP) 30 mm Hg. The posterior segment was normal. There was no history of contact lens usage. The IOP was measured by which technique in this question?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

The diagnosis is Herpes simplex dendritic ulcer
In corneal infection, contact procedure should not be done.
Pulsair is non contact tonometer

questions.text: Bullae are seen in which layer in bullous keratopathy?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

The roblem lies in endothelium, but the bullae is seen in epithelium of cornea

questions.text: Which of the following match is correct?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

a-    Ganglion cells (1 in histopath)
b-    Muller cell in inner nuclear layer (2 in histopath)
c-    Biploar cell in inner nuclear layer (2 in histopath)
d-    Retinal pigment epithelium (5 in histopath)

3- outer nuclear layer
4- photoreceptor

choices.text: Inner 6 layers are supplied by external carotid artery system
There is no anastomoses between the vessels
Inner blood retinal barrier is formed by retinal capillary endothelial cells
The foveal avascular zone is a region within the fovea at the centre of the retina that is devoid of retinal blood vessels.

questions.text: Which of the following is not true for the retinal vascular supply
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Inner 6 layers are supplied by central retinal artery,which is branch of ophthalmic artery, a branch of internal carotid artery

questions.text: In which of the following test, a dye is used?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

a- Optical Coherence Tomography
b- Angiography (fluorescein dye is used)
c- Amsler grid
d-Pin hole

choices.text: The fovea is involved in this
Central retinal artery occlusion can be a differential

questions.text: Which is not true for the given pic is in which layer of retina?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Cherry red spot
Fovea is spared in it

questions.text: A 58 year old patient was diagnosed with Primary angle closure glaucoma and was started with Latanoprost eye drop daily. He presented with decreased vision with distostion of vision. On Optical coherence tomography, which of the following can be seen?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

a- macular hole
b- pigment epithelial detachment
c- cystoid macular edema
d-central serous retinopathy
Prostaglandins can cause CME

Vitreo-macular traction leading to macular hole

questions.text: A 13-year-old girl with abnormal electrophysiological test in which Arden ration was noted less than 1.85 can have which of these?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

a-    Angiography showing ink-blot/smoke stack appearance in central serous retinopathy
b-    Autofluoroscence showing lipofuscin deposit in Best disease
c-    Angiography showing cystoid macular edema (in this question due to post cataract surgery inflammation breaking inner blood retinal barrier)
d-    Angiography showing micro-aneurysm in NPDR

questions.text: A type 2 diabetes mellitus was diagnosed with proliferative diabetic retinopathy. Which of the following corresponds to the diagnosis according to ETDRS (Early treatment of diabetic retinopathy study) staging?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

a-    few intra-retinal hemorrages and hard exudates (mild-moderate NPDR)
b-    retinal new vessels on disc and elsewhere (PDR)
c-    intra-retinal hemorrages, hard and soft exudates (mild-moderate NPDR)
d-    pre-retinal hemorrage (PDR)

questions.text: A Type 2 Diabetes mellitus patient’s angiography revealed the following. What is the area marked showing?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Angiography showing hypofluoroscence- ischemic retina

questions.text: A 45 yr old hypertensive patient with 6/12 vision with inferior visual field defect with tortuous retinal veins, intraretinal hemorrages is most likely to have
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Inferior visual field defect means superior retina is involved
Tortuous veins with hemorrages goes in favour of retinal vein occlusion

questions.text: Which match is correct (Patient is ased to close eyes in b image?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

a-    left aponeurotic ptosis (due to levator aponeurotic (structure 2) disinsertion)
b-    lagophthalmous (due to orbicularis (structure 1) palsy)
c-    left congenital ptosis as decreased lid crease (due to Levator muscle (structure 3) maldevelopment)
d-    left Horner syndrome (due to Muller (structure 4) involvement)

choices.text: Anisocoria will be most appreciated in light
In case of Syringomyelia associated related condition, sweating of that side of face will be affected
In case of Pancoast tumour associated related condition, pre ganglion fibres will be affected
In case of Cavernous sinus syndrome associated related condition, sweating of that side of face will be normal

questions.text: For a patient of Horner syndrome, all will be true except?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

In Horner syndrome, eye is miotis and difficulty to dilate. The difference in pupil size (anisocoria) is more appreciated in dark as normal pupil will dilate in dark.

questions.text: Calculate the amount of ptosis for the right eye of a patient with following findings Corneal diameter= 12mm Palpebral fissure height in primary gaze= 5 mm
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Upper eyelid is covering 7 mm
Ptosis is 5 mm, as 2mm of cornea is normally covered by upper eyelid

choices.text: It is in lesser wing of sphenoid
It is in the roof of orbit
Central retinal artery passes through this

questions.text: Which is not true for the fissure marked?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Optic canal
Ophthalmic artery passes through it

questions.text: A 31 year old woman was brought to the emergency department because of severe left eye pain, redness and bulging. She gave history of sinusitis recently for which she took medications. On examination, the corneal sensations were also decreased in left eye. On further examination, it was seen that there was difficulty in abducting right eye as well. Which of these might be the diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

The sequence could be sinusitis- leading to orbital cellulitis- and completed to cavernous sinus involvement (as other eye is also involved: 6th nerve is involved in other eye)

questions.text: A child with acute painful proptosis underwent exenteration. There were small round cells on histopathology which turned to be desmin positive. What is the management?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Desmin positive in Rhabdomyosarcoma
Orbital cellulitis does not have round cell tumour

choices.text: Fusiform appearance of optic nerve tumour

questions.text: A 16 year old boy was brought to your clinic with a history seizures and skin lesions as in picture. On ocular examination, there were some iris nodules. Which of these cannot be seen in the systemic condition associated?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Axillary freckling in NF-1
Echhymosis (periorbital hematoma) is  seen in neuroblastoma
Spenoid dysplasia can lead to transmitted pulsatile proptosis
Plexiform neurofibroma of eyelid can be seen

choices.text: No pupil constriction in both eyes

questions.text: A person was diagnosed to have such visual field defect as shown. On shining torch light to his right eye what reaction will be seen?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Right anopia in right optic nerve lesion
No reaction in both eyes if light shown in affected side

questions.text: During pupil examination of a patient, anisocoria was noted which. Slit lamp examination revealed normal iris pattern and pupil shape. There was no pupil constriction in left eye with diluted pilocarpine or after instillation of 1% pilocarpine. What’s the possible diagnosis
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Iris sphincter damage will not have normal iris pattern
Adie constrict with diluted pilocarpine
3rd nerve paly pupil does constrict with 1% pilocarpine
Pharmacological dilated pupil with atropine does not constrict with 1% pilocarpine

questions.text: The following visual field defect was noted in a patient. Likely site of lesion is in?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Left homonymous superior quadrant-anopia
Seen in right temporal lobe lesions

questions.text: Which drug can cause these visual field defects?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Tunnel or tubular visual field defects
Vigabatrin and quinine can cause
Other causes – retinitis pigmentosa
Gyrate dystrophy
Advanced glaucoma
Pan retinal photocoagulation

choices.text: Play role in maintaining corneal transparency

questions.text: Which is true for the layer marked of cornea?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Epithelium of cornea
Its derived from surface ectoderm
Rest corneal layers from neural crest

questions.text: The animated picture depicts types of ________?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Staphyloma is thinning of outer fibrous layer of eye with lining of uveal tissue and bulging

questions.text: A patient with thick glasses had history of floaters, flashes with curtain falling from above. He was seen in eye clinic and immediately posted for a surgery in which silicone oil was also used. Many months later, the patient can present with which of the following findings?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

a- arcus senilis
b- band keratopathy (seen due to calcification of cornea, may be after silicone oil in vitreoretinal surgery done for rhegmatgenous retinal detachment in the question)
c- kaiser Fleisher ring
d-Vortex keratopathy

questions.text: A child presented to clinic with diffuse redness, pain and discharge. On examination, the conjunctival surface of the upper eyelid shows a follicular and inflammatory response. He was treated accordingly. He was seen after 1 month. Which of these will be seen?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Follicles suggest conjunctival infection.  The child probably had acute trachoma initially and later seen in clinic with scarred conjunctuctiva (Arlt line)
a-    Horner Tranta dots in vernal keratoconjunctivitis
b-    Pterygium
c-    Conjuncticval papilla
d-    Arlt line

choices.text: The optimal position of the globe for testing the elevator function of the superior rectus muscle is when the globe is abducted 23°
The optimal position of the globe for testing the depressor function of the inferior rectus muscle is when the globe is abducted 23°
The optimal position of the globe for testing the depressor function of the superior oblique muscle is when the globe is adducted 51°
The optimal position of the globe for testing the elevator function of the inferior oblique muscle is when the globe is abducted 51°

questions.text: Which is false statement among these?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

When the globe is abducted 23°, eye gets aligned to SR and IR
When the globe is adducted 51°, eye gets aligned to SO and IO

choices.text: It is a type of version
Right superior rectus and left inferior oblique are involved here
The muscles involved here are antagonist muscles of each other

questions.text: A patient was asked to perform this action while testing his extraocular muscles. Which is not true among the following?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Dextro-elevation (a type of version)
The muscles involved here are yoke muscles of each other

questions.text: Which muscle is involved if there is lesion in pons?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

A- is lateral rectus muscle supplied by 6th nerve (nucleus in pons)

questions.text: Which of the following is not a test of suppression of eye?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

a-    Maddox rod
b-    Prism bar cover test
c-    Synaptophore
d-    Worth 4 dot test
Synaptophore is used in measuring angle of deviation, binocularity, stereopsis, suppression
Prism bar cover test is for determining angle of deviation

questions.text: Which of the following cannot be example of nerve palsy?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)


a-    Right LR (6th nerve) palsy
b-    Right 3rd nerve palsy
c-    Esophoria on cover-uncover test
d-    Right 4th nerve palsy

questions.text: Which muscle palsy is here?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Left SO palsy
Hypertropia is increasing on left head tilt

questions.text: A patient wears +3.00 with + 2.25 × 90°. Which of the following keratometry values correspond to the prescription of glasses, assuming all of her astigmatism is corneal?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

On conversion of prescription of glasses, vertical axis comes to be steeper. (+ 3D in vertical, + 5.25D in horizontal axis)
Vertical axis is steeper in only option C

choices.text: Simple myopic astigmatism against the rule
Compound hyperopic astigmatism against the rule
Simple hypermetropic astigmatism against the rule
Compound hyperopic astigmatism with the rule

questions.text: During retinoscopy, the following was observed. The working distance of 1m. Which situation exists for this patient (no cycloplegia was given). What is the objective refraction of this eye?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

when the retinoscopy streak was kept vertical, horizontal axis is being checked
And vice versa
In this q
-2D in horizontal axis and +1D in vertical axis
Distance is subtracted from both axis (1D for  1 m)
Final power
-3D in horizontal axis and 0 in vertical axis
Horizontal is more steeper axis

choices.text: Simple hypermetropic astigmatism with the rule
Compound myopic astigmatism against the rule
Compound hypermetropic astigmatism with the rule

questions.text: The final prescription given to a patient for one eye was +2.00DS, -1.00DC ×180 degrees. What type of refractive error is this?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

+2.00DS, -1.00DC ×180
Converting it to axis
The vertical axis will have +1D
Horizontal axis will have +2D
Vertical is steeper, with the rule

questions.text: In which of the following, the causation is not same as rest?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

a-    Cherry red spot
b-    Irido-dialysis
c-    Vossius ring
d-    Iris coloboma (due to failure of closure of embryonic fissure)
A,b and c are due to blunt trauma
